1526455814_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6n.body:
Also, don't underestimate the proxies for onboarding. New people don't want to install an unknown software first to see how it looks. But when they see how cool it is, they are more likely to install it, and start using it.
With ipfs it is so painless. There is a clearnet address that always works, and the browser plugin redirects from there.
With Zeronet in contrast, the proxies are failing one after another. A link I post on cleanet might work anywhere between an hour and a few months at max.

1572896334_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body:
> [merithtk](#comment_78_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKzqW6F8): how does that even work?

The basics are here:
https://git-scm.com/doc
If you want to use it with an untrusted server, you can use something like this:
https://ulrichard.ch/blog/index.php/2012/12/23/locally-encrypted-remote-storage/
